bug.author: treuille
bug.summary: Widgets with identical "ids" should raise exception
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
If you name, for example, two buttons 'abc', you will get some weird behavior (see below). To avoid this, we should ensure that no two widgets have the same name by raising an exception should the user violate this rule. <denchmark-h:h2>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
Run the following code: import streamlit as st
if st.button('abc'): st.success('First button fired.') if st.button('abc'): st.success('Second button fired.') <denchmark-h:h1>Behavior</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior</denchmark-h>
The button appears twice (no exceptions thrown): <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1673013/64039422-459a0c80-caf6-11e9-8ddc-64f13cf17f8a.png></denchmark-link>
and when you click the button, it fires twice: <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1673013/64039430-492d9380-caf6-11e9-9d3f-a945efacebc5.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
The second button named 'abc' should raise an exception. <denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
Not sure. <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>$ streamlit version && python --version && pyenv --version && sw_vers && "/Applications/Google Chrome.app/Contents/MacOS/Google Chrome" --version
Streamlit, version 0.45.0 Python 3.6.5 pyenv 1.2.3 ProductName: Mac OS X ProductVersion: 10.14.6 BuildVersion: 18G84 Google Chrome 76.0.3809.132 </denchmark-code>

comments.comment: Alternatively, have an additional parameter for name, so that two buttons can have the same label but different behavior

Agreed <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ebonet>@ebonet</denchmark-link> . And I think we should do both, actually:
If there are 2 widgets with the same internal id (which is a combination of name, type, and params), show an exception Provide a key kwarg that will be used for disambiguating the id (by including it in the ID computation, along with the other terms)
(And the exception would explain how to fix the issue by passing a key kwarg.)
What if two widgets have the same label and key? That should be an exception, right?
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/treuille>@treuille</denchmark-link> - yeah, this is also handled in the referenced PR
